blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

summary: I think that Nott believes getting changed back into a halfling will be an instant fix to all her problems, and it would...
body:
I think that Nott believes getting changed back into a halfling will be an instant fix to all her problems, and it would certainly improve a lot of things for her in the short term! But it’s pretty apparent that she’s struggled with self esteem all her life and that becoming a goblin has just made all her insecurities twenty times worse. So while she’ll probably feel better right away when/if she gets changed back to her old self, if the root of her problems isn’t addressed, it’s just going to keep plaguing her all her life.

So what I really want is for her friends to really help her work on improving her self esteem and learn to feel good about herself, and I want Yeza to see her as a goblin and show her that of course he’ll always love her no matter what she looks like. I want her to get to a point where she could conceivably be okay staying as a goblin. It’s not the ideal situation and not want she wants, but she has grown to learn to love herself and has confidence that her loved ones will care for her and support her no matter what, and she could…live like this. She still wants her old body back, but she could live and be okay how she is right now. And THEN after she’s reached that point I want her to get changed back into a halfling. I feel like that would be the best possible ending for her, to get that inner growth and healing and a body she’s comfortable with.

(And I also want her to learn that all goblins aren’t evil but that’s another subject)

tags: i'm watching the pikelan supercut can you tell
summary: i’m still fascinated by pike’s anger when scanlan returned after his year away because 1) it turned pretty quickly considering...
body:
i’m still fascinated by pike’s anger when scanlan returned after his year away because 1) it turned pretty quickly considering just how angry she initially was and 

2) pike wanted to fight. she baited him A Lot in that first day or so of his return. she did the whole “i hear tiny violins” thing and “is that what gnomes do?” and “i don’t care what you do.” it’s not that surprising since while she is a devotee of forgiveness she is also feisty by nature. but scanlan unequivocally did not want to fight. he took all the abuse without defending his position. and she was left in between feeling proud, presumably, for showing signs of becoming a better person and dissatisfied he wouldn’t fight back with her.

tags: I don't know whether this is controversial or not
but I'm seeing a lot of great Veth art
and there's a lot of different interpretations
but I'm getting flashbacks to the whole debate about whether Nott should be allowed to be cute or not
this time around I just wanted to say my piece regarding Veth
(also I feel the need to point out that whenever I make posts like this I am not talking about things like)
(changing character's race or skin colour and whitewashing characters... that shit is damaging/racist don't do it)
summary: Hot take: I don’t care at all whether people draw Veth as a conventionally beautiful halfling or not, whether she is drawn...
body:
Hot take: I don’t care at all whether people draw Veth as a conventionally beautiful halfling or not, whether she is drawn chubby or not, whether she has a crooked nose or teeth or not…. And I really hope that nobody is going to bash artists who decide to draw Veth as a beautiful or cute halfling, for one very simple reason: 

The only thing Nott has told us is that she thought she wasn’t pretty and that she thought others didn’t think she was pretty. Body Dysmorphic Disorder doesn’t give a flying fuck about what the actual reality is. You can be the most beautiful person on the planet and still think you’re ugly and try to hide yourself away from the world… It’s a serious disorder, and it doesn’t matter how many people tell you you’re actually pretty - you usually don’t belief them (or worse, think they’re taking the piss and start isolating yourself even more!)

So yeah, any interpretation of Veth’s actual looks are completely fine with me. I think drawing Veth in a way that makes her not conventionally attractive is great. I love the idea of ‘conserving’ that aspect of what made a lot of people like Nott in the first place (a weird, little, strange-looking gremlin of a character) in the new ‘Veth’ look as well. It’s empowering to see non-conventionally attractive characters who are still cool, kind, caring, smart funny and awesome being represented in art that way. Fucking A+++

But I also think drawing Veth as a beautiful halfling who struggles deeply with self-hatred/body dysmorphic disorder is equally as powerful a take on the character. It shows that feelings can be disconnected from reality, and that for a lot of people dealing with this kind of struggle, the only thing that really matters is how they feel about themselves. Seeing Veth learn to accept her beautiful self or her not-so-beautiful self is a strong message regardless of whether WE find her attractive or not. 

I think saying Veth can’t be drawn beautiful sends a VERY wrong message, because it invalidates the feelings of people who are in similar shoes (it’s starts getting dangerously close to saying that people who are pretty aren’t allowed to feel ugly, that their feelings aren’t real or make no sense… which is the opposite of helpful, and at worst, a damaging thing to hear for people with BDD.)

So eh… yeah. Artists, you do you, don’t let anyone else stop you.

tags: they’s all a bunch of drama llamas
summary:
From feeling each other up in circus tents to ubiquitous flirtations.
From ‘death threats’ to making blood pacts at the bottom...
body:
From feeling each other up in circus tents to ubiquitous flirtations.

From ‘death threats’ to making blood pacts at the bottom of the ocean.

From off-handed innuendo to frantic searching when the other’s disappeared.

Do Fjord and Caleb know how to ‘low key’ anything?!

reblog.comment:

From off-handed innuendo to frantic searching when the other’s disappeared.

blog.name: mamaleh6994
blog.title: On to Iconium
blog.description: I'm Kelsey. I knit pure joy in the hearts of friends.

summary:
Last year during an episode of CriticalRole, Matt
 mentioned casually that one of Pumat Sol's duplicates was holding 
knitting...
body:
Last year during an episode of CriticalRole, Matt mentioned casually that one of Pumat Sol’s duplicates was holding knitting needles. I took that as a sign that clearly, I needed to knit a Pumat Sol. As of today he is finally finished! 

I went through so many different versions of his nose, his hair, his clothes, etc. and took pictures along the way, so if you’re at all interested in how I put him together, check out my knitting blog post about him here :)

blog.name: rijomu
blog.title: Kui?
blog.description: Basically a place for me to post and reblog things that I like. Feminism, Marvel, Star Trek, Voltron, Critical Role and the occasional weird insect. I'm female, Finnish (if the title of the blog didn't give that away), middle-aged and a librarian. Draw any conclusion you want.

summary:
Episode 49 and after
One thing that I haven’t seen addressed is, what did the soldiers guarding the tunnels do after the M9 went...
body:
Episode 49 and after

One thing that I haven’t seen addressed is, what did the soldiers guarding the tunnels do after the M9 went underground. Did they send someone back into town with a message about crazy people who said the were with the Cobalt Soul, going into the tunnels? Are the mages or other higher-ups going to be waiting at the entrace when M9 come back? Will they send someone after them?

summary:
Six hours to go. 
I don’t think the Mighty Nein will catch up with Xhorhasians and Yeza quite yet. Most likely the episode will...
body:
Six hours to go.

I don’t think the Mighty Nein will catch up with Xhorhasians and Yeza quite yet. Most likely the episode will be spent fighting weird underground critters and/or traps the Xhorhasians left behind.

But if they do catch up, my wild guess is that they’ll end up trading the dodecahedron for Yeza. Something will go sideways and it’ll end in a mess but a trade will be suggested.

blog.name: tusklovethebook
blog.title: Tusk Love, the Excerpts
blog.description:
THE SECOND SERIES FEATURED IS BY THE TALENTED WALLLFLOWERART

Tusk Love is Tal'Dorei's best-selling romance fiction novel series, first found by Critical Role's the Mighty Nein in the Chastity's Nook in Zadash.

The story of the second novel deals with the beautiful romance between Mizara, a trans half-orc woman with taste for the exotic and strange and Vulri, a hard-hitting go-getter who will stop at nothing to protect the love of her life.

They met on one of Hupperdook's many raves, and fell in love before the sun rose once more...

title: Tusk Love’s January Chapter Incoming!
body:
Hello lovelies,

I hope this new year has brought some positive changes; if not, the year has just begun it’ll get better!

As for Tusk Love, I will be releasing a new chapter tonight! Bit of fluff, bit of smut, bit of Critical Role lore-friendliness and bit of creative ‘imaginings’. A nice mixture, I think.

I wish you a great day and a lovely evening.

(Can’t wait for the episode tonight!!!)
